Post: "I've been struggling with depression and suicidal thoughts for what feels like an eternity. It's like everything in my life is a constant reminder that I'm just not good enough. I can't seem to shake off this feeling of hopelessness, no matter how hard I try. I feel like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. But I know I can't give up. I have to keep pushing forward, even when it feels like everything is against me. I want to live a life that's filled with purpose and happiness, but it's hard to see that when all I feel is pain and suffering. I guess I just have to keep fighting and hope that someday, things will get better."
Transferred_Post:
"I've been struggling with depression and suicidal thoughts for a while now. It's like everything in my life is a constant reminder that I'm just not good enough. I can't seem to shake off this feeling of hopelessness, no matter how hard I try. I feel like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. But I know I can't give up. I have to keep pushing forward, even when it feels like everything is against me. I want to live a life that's filled with purpose and happiness, but it's hard to see that when all I feel is pain and suffering. I guess I just have to keep fighting and hope that someday, things will get better."

However, it's important to note that the transferred post still has a global attributional style, as the causes of the individual's depression and suicidal thoughts are still attributed to various aspects of their life. To convert this post to a specific attributional style, you would need to identify specific events or circumstances that contribute to the individual's feelings of hopelessness and despair. For example:

Transferred Post: "I've been feeling really down since I lost my job last month. It's like everything in my life is a constant reminder that I'm just not good enough. I can't seem to shake off this feeling of hopelessness, no matter how hard I try. I feel like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. But I know I can't give up. I have to keep pushing forward, even when it feels like everything is against me. I want to live a life that's filled with purpose and happiness, but it's hard to see that when all I feel is pain and suffering. I guess I just have to keep fighting and hope that someday, things will get better."

In this transferred post, the individual's depression and suicidal thoughts are attributed to a specific event (losing their job) rather than a global attributional style (feeling like they're not good enough). This post has a specific attributional style, as the causes of the individual's feelings are attributed to a specific circumstance (losing their job) rather than various aspects of their life.

Post:
"I'm still reeling from my recent breakup, and it feels like the pain will never subside. I'm starting to wonder if I'll ever be able to move on and find happiness again."

This post exhibits a global attributional style because it takes a negative event (the breakup) and extends its impact to the individual's entire life (their ability to find happiness). It implies that the breakup has caused a broad and lasting impact, affecting not just their romantic life but also their overall well-being and future prospects.
